comment.editorialComment: The original forecast of -1.5% has been adjusted to 0.0% to reflect recent Black Book movements.

There was quite a hike in volumes in this sector 3 years ago and we would expect to see the result of this by an increase in the volumes of cars in the used market. That said, this sector is always a popular choice amongst most buyers and most makes/models offer something for everybody and also tend to represent good value along with sensible running costs. We can expect there to be some momentum carried over from the new plate activity during September but there is also likely to be the expected slowdown as we approach the end of the year. The combination of these 2 factors probably means that there may be a bit of stability in values at the beginning of the month but by the end of the month we would expect to see the market dropping away and values will probably fall by around -1%.

Although the market is likely to toughen up during the course of November, there will still be some demand for most vehicles in this sector. These cars tend to represent good value for money to both trade and retail buyers alike. Over the last few years many buyers have been moving away from this sector into the heavily populated Crossover market that now exists so we are beginning to see fewer cars but there is still a ready market and if bought correctly these cars tend not to be too much of a threat in terms of stock holding costs and time to retail. Our forecast is that values will move back by around -2.5% during the course of the month.
